com.tanny.customhighlight.HighlightTextV.android:text: The HTTP client’s job is to accept your request and produce its response. This is simple in theory but it gets tricky in practice.Each HTTP request contains a URL, a method (like GET or POST), and a list of headers. When your requested URL has moved, the webserver will return a response code like 302 to indicate the document’s new URL. OkHttp will follow the redirect to retrieve a final response.For synchronous calls, you bring your own thread and are responsible for managing how many simultaneous requests you make. Too many simultaneous connections wastes resources; too few harms latency.
